snippet: One woman had her throat slashed and the body of the other was discovered decomposing in a suitcase on a balcony.
abstract: Hong Kong police say British man Rurik Jutting is arrested after bodies of two women are found in his upscale apartment; he is identified as former employee of Bank of America Merrill Lynch.

byline.original: By MICHAEL FORSYTHE and MICHAEL J. de la MERCED
byline.contributor: Michael Forsythe reported from Hong Kong and Michael J. de la Merced from San Francisco. Chris Buckley and Alexandra Stevenson contributed reporting from Hong Kong.

lead_paragraph: One woman had her throat slashed and the body of the other was discovered decomposing in a suitcase on a balcony.

headline.main: Hong Kong Police Arrest British Banker After 2 Women’s Bodies Are Found
headline.print_headline: Hong Kong Police Arrest Briton After Bodies Found
